This place was recommended to me by native Catalan friends that live in BCN so I do not consider it a tourist trap as another reviewer claims.  I thought it was excellent especially considering some other tapas bars that I tried.  Everything came out piping hot, nicely seasoned and fresh.  Beef was better than most other places in BCN, whelks, razor clams, tomato bread, peppers, seared foie with sweet balsamic reduction, it was all good. Recommend reservations and be prepared to eat fast cuz they like to turn over the tables
